wekaizing
Class WekaData

java.lang.Object
  wekaizing.WekaData

public class WekaData
extends java.lang.Object

Class that handles datasets, created to make it as easy as possible to create own data from scratch. Since Weka Instances class requires the attributes to be set before anything, this class acts as a wrapper both for Instances, and for use by classifiers to make things easier.

Author:
Barkin Aygun
See Also:
weka.core.instances, weka.core.attribute

AddAttribute

public Attribute AddAttribute(java.lang.String attrName,
                              java.lang.Object[] nominal_values)
Adds a nominal attribute to the attributes set, nominal attributes are ones with defined set of countable values

Parameters:
attrName - Name of the attribute
nominal_values - Set of values for the attribute
Returns:
Attribute created

InsertData

public void InsertData(java.lang.Object[][] data)
Use this function to enter big amount of data, takes in a 2D array of objects where each row is a single instance and parses the values to their classes.

Parameters:
data - 2D array of Objects for instances x values

GetDataIntoArray

public double[][] GetDataIntoArray()
Prints the data into a double array, the behavior is undefined if there are string data.

Returns:
2D array of instances x values with doubles

setClassIndex

public void setClassIndex(int index)
Sets the indexed attribute to the class attribute

Parameters:

AddClustersAsClass

public void AddClustersAsClass(int[] clusters)
A function that takes an int array of cluster indices and adds them as an attribute, RemoveClustersFromData() should be called after handling this method

Parameters:
clusters - Integer array of cluster indices in the same order with the dataset

RemoveClustersFromData

public void RemoveClustersFromData()
A helper function that removes the last attribute, so make sure it is called after AddClustersAsClass(int[] clusters)
